confidence: High for mostly dry, settled weather for the coming week. Lower confidence for cloud details from late Wednesday onwards. High for a transition to more unsettled and colder weather on Saturday

days.summary: Dry with mostly clear skies and light winds, allowing mist or fog to form in valleys and a touch of frost in places.

days.meteorologist_view: It will feel chilly at height despite light winds, especially in the morning and evening with some overnight frost. Fog will stay confined to valleys and lower elevations.
days.summary: Another dry, bright day with sunny spells. A cold start with frost and some fog patches in the valleys. Fog developing again in valleys through the evening.
days.visibility: Very good visibility with summits mainly clear but the odd patch of cloud around 700 to 800m.
days.ground_conditions: No recent ground conditions report available.
days.weather: Dry, bright with sunny spells. Some overnight fog, frost.

days.summary: A dry, bright morning with sunny spells. A cold start with frost and some fog patches in the valleys. Clouding over through the day with some patchy light rain or drizzle.
days.cloud_free_top: 90% in the morning, falling to 30% by the evening.
days.max_wind: West veering northwest, increasing to 20mph, gusting 30mph.
days.visibility: Very good visibility in the morning with summits mainly clear but the odd patch of cloud around 700 to 800m, and fog in the valleys. Cloud becomes quite extensive through the afternoon and evening, shrouding most summits, with visibilities falling poor in drizzle or hill fog.

days.summary: Cloudy morning and evening with hill fog and patchy light drizzle, becoming brighter through the middle of the day. Light northerly backing westerly winds. Freezing level above summits.
Staying cloudy with hill fog and patchy light drizzle. Light to fresh westerly winds. Freezing level above summits.
Early rain clearing south. Then bright spells and some showers, wintry at height with freezing levels falling to 500-600m. Fresh northwest winds.
